snippet: For seven weeks, tenants in a storefront on Delancey Street will range from a syringe-exchange program for homeless transients to an online community of knitters.
abstract: Architect Eric Ho has begun project Made in the Lower East Side, or MiLES, in which empty storefronts will house pop-up businesses with a social bent, from needle exchange program to online community of knitters; project offers way to utilize empty space and house organizations that cannot afford permanent home; money to rent the storefronts has been raised through crowdfunding website Kickstarter.
lead_paragraph: For seven weeks, tenants in a storefront on Delancey Street will range from a syringe-exchange program for homeless transients to an online community of knitters.

headline.main: The Pop-Up Activist of the Lower East Side
headline.print_headline: The Pop-Up Activist of the Lower East Side
